intro: Eriogonum ciliatum, commonly known as the silky cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the rose family (Rosaceae) and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems. Eriogonum ciliatum is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
